Entities.Name: Drug Name
Entities.Definition: The commercial or generic name of a medication as it appears in the text.

Entities.Name: Strength
Entities.Definition: The concentration or quantity of a drug taken at one time.

Entities.Name: Route
Entities.Definition: The way the medication is administered to the patient, such as oral or intravenous.

Sample Data.Sentence: Administer Penicillin V Potassium 500 mg orally.

Entities.Name: Frequency
Entities.Definition: How often the medication is to be taken.

Sample Data.Sentence: Take two tablets every four to six hours as needed.
Sample Data.Annotated: Frequency: every four to six hours

Entities.Name: Form
Entities.Definition: The physical form of the medication, such as tablet or capsule.

Sample Data.Sentence: Medication is provided in the form of a liquid.

Entities.Name: Dose Amount
Entities.Definition: The specific amount of medication prescribed for intake.

Sample Data.Sentence: Take one tablet three times a day.

Entities.Name: Duration
Entities.Definition: The length of time the medication should be taken.

Sample Data.Sentence: Continue with Metformin for the next 30 days.

Dataset.Name: Synthetic Derivative Database
Dataset.Details: A dataset of de-identified clinical notes from the Vanderbilt University Medical Center, used for training and validating the MedEx system.

Annotation Guidelines.Description: The system uses a combination of lexical databases, regular expressions, and rule-based approaches for the extraction of medication information from unstructured clinical narratives.
